DOC.brief_summary: This study will investigate the influence of injection speed on pain during injection of lidocaine. It is anticipated that a longer injection time will lead to less pain for the patient during the injection. This hypothesis will be tested on healthy volunteers, who will each receive three injections with the same amount of lidocaine subcutaneously on the abdomen. The injections will be given over 15, 30 and 45 seconds. After each injection, the subject will be asked to evaluate the pain on a Visual analog scale (0-100 mm). The aim of the study is to find a simple method for pain reduction that can be used in clinical practice.
DOC.brief_title: The Influence of Injection Speed on Pain During Administration of Local Anaesthetic.
DOC.criteria: Age 1865 years Kidney, heart or liver disease Eczema or psoriasis on injection site Neuropathy Regular use of painkillers Hypersensitivity of Lidocaine Pregnancy Diabetes
